DOC.brief_summary: An individual randomised controlled trial (RCT) to evaluate the effectiveness of a voice-based mobile phone health (mHealth) intervention to support post-abortion family planning (PAFP) at four Marie Stopes International clinics in Cambodia. The study seeks to address the research question: does a PAFP mHealth intervention increase use of contraception in Cambodia?
DOC.brief_title: Mobile Technology for Improved Family Planning
DOC.criteria: Client attending for abortion Client does not want to have a child at the current time Client aged 18 or over Client owns a mobile phone Client willing to receive simple voice messages relating to contraception from Marie Stopes in Khmer language Not meeting inclusion criteria Declined to participate
